title: Rotational equilibrium teacher student and board

content.question: A teacher and student sit on a uniform, horizontal board that rests on a pivot. The board can rotate about the pivot with negligible friction. The teacher weighs <math alttext="800 newtons" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>800</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>N</mtext></math> and sits <math alttext="1.0 meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1.0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m</mtext></math> to the left of the pivot. The student weighs <math alttext="400 newtons" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>400</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>N</mtext></math> and sits <math alttext="2.0 meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2.0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m</mtext></math> to the right of the pivot, as shown. At time <math alttext="t equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>, the teacher and student simultaneously lift their feet off the ground so that the board is free to rotate. Which of the following describes the motion of the board immediately after <math alttext="t equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math> ?

choices.label: The board rotates counterclockwise at first, then clockwise to return to its initial orientation.

topic.text: 5.5: Rotational Equilibrium and Newton's First Law in Rotational Form

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
